Ad Text:
Our Client requires a Business Analyst to bridge between Business needs and Program solutions. You will possess a unique blend of business acumen, analytical skills, and communication expertise.

Key responsibilities:

Scheduling and facilitation of small to medium sized meetings and workshops with key stakeholders to gather business needs.
Business Case development in conjunction with the Strategic Asset Management Framework.
Progression of the Business Case through funding submission cycle and liaison with external stakeholders.
Business process analysis, process diagrams development, gap analysis and recommendation on processes improvement.
Creating a range of detailed plans, workflows and checklists to support Business Case development.
Working closely with stakeholders and project teams to analyse business processes procedures and requirements in order to establish requirements and ensure solutions support the defined scope of business requirements.
Provision of best practice and unbiased solution advice based on requirements.
Participation in weekly progress meetings with key Managers.

Skills Required:

Meeting/Workshop facilitation experience
Key Stakeholder management and relationship building (Internal & External),
Coordinating and Managing Project Teams
Manage Major Projects and facilitating weekly progress meetings
Providing solution support and team support
Business Analyst including Business Process Analysis experience of at least 2 years

At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Shape Your World

At Alcoa, you will become an essential part of our purpose: to turn raw potential into real progress. The way we see it, every Alcoan is a work-shaper, team-shaper, idea-shaper, world-shaper.

As a leader within Alcoa, you can help fulfill our purpose and realise our vision to build a legacy of excellence for future generations. Be part of the team that is helping shape a better workplace with the flexibility and equal opportunities that help everyone thrive. You have the power to shape things and individuals to make them better.

About the Role

As the Regional Directional Studies Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our business. You will be responsible for identifying, evaluating, and developing strategic options for Alcoa's future growth, sustainability, and improvement initiatives. This position is central to shaping investment decisions and unlocking long-term value from our resources.

In this role, you will lead and coordinate strategic studies related to regional business options, geological exploration, and mine development planning. You'll lead cross-functional study teams, including consultants and contractors, and manage studies from early-phase concepts to pre-feasibility. You will need to use a strong balance of technical acumen, commercial insight, and stakeholder engagement to navigate complex factors and ensure all viable options are assessed.

A key part of your role will be your ability to use conceptual thinking and an analytical mindset to clearly define complex problems and explore multiple solution pathways. You will be responsible for leading teams through ambiguity and competing priorities to ensure that study outcomes are robust and strategically sound.

Key Responsibilities include:

Lead the analysis of options to determine which studies to advance; while also leading the development of early-phase studies to ensure they align with objectives, timelines, and budgets.

Coordinate with various functions, including operations, geology, finance, and external partners, to align study milestones with broader business timelines.

Ensure regulatory compliance for all study options and integrate safety and risk management, from hazard identification to risk assessments, into the study design from the very beginning.

Lead cross-functional study teams, mentor junior staff, and develop tools to track study progress and budget adherence.

Leverage strong communication and interpersonal skills to engage with diverse groups and synthesize their input into clear, cohesive recommendations.

Focus on delivering actionable and realistic studies, ensuring that conceptual ideas can be practically implemented.

What’s on offer

The opportunity to play a pivotal role in Alcoa’s growth and sustainability strategy.

Work with diverse teams and stakeholders across continents.

Attractive remuneration and variable bonus plan.

Employee growth and development opportunities.

Vehicle allowance and Superannuation above guaranteed rate.

Connect and be part of a community that celebrates diversity through our employee inclusion groups.

What you can bring to the role

A Tertiary Degree (e.g., a BSc) in Engineering, Geology, Mining, or a related field. A postgraduate degree (e.g., MBA, PhD, or a relevant Masters) is highly regarded.

Proven experience in mining or study/project management, including the ability to manage both direct and indirect stakeholders.

Demonstrated expert understanding of mining processes and risk management within a study coupled with proven experience in options analysis and the development of business cases that integrate both technical and commercial insights.

Strong communication, leadership, and stakeholder engagement skills, which allow you to work effectively with diverse teams and present findings to senior leadership.

Previous experience delivering completed studies that inform the capital project pipeline.

Additional information

Interviews may progress prior to the closing date, although all applications will be considered.

You will only be contacted if you are shortlisted for an interview, this process can take up to four weeks from the closing date.

#LI-WM1

#LI-Hybrid

About the Location

Alcoa Australia’s company headquarters is located at 235 St Georges Terrace in Perth CBD, Western Australia, on Whadjuk Noongar land. The office is conveniently close to public transport and parking, and hosts employees from various business functions, including Commercial, Finance, Sustainability, Communications, and Human Resources, as well as expert teams supporting local and global locations. Our head office offers modern, open-plan working facilities and excellent end-of-trip amenities within a state-of-the-art building.

We are values led, vision driven and united by our purpose of transforming raw potential into real progress.  Our commitments to Inclusion, Diversity & Equity include providing trusting workplaces that are safe, respectful and inclusive of all individuals, free from discrimination, bullying and harassment and that our workplaces reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.    

This is a place where you are empowered to do your best work, be your authentic self, and feel a true sense of belonging. Come join us and shape your career!  

Your work. Your world. Shape them for the better.

Highly sought after NSW Government Organisation

Up to $1008 Daily Rate

Contract until 30/06/2026



Our client is a large NSW Government Organisation who are seeking Technical Business Analyst to join their team. 



The Technical Business Analyst oversees the implementation of technical business projects and solutions, carries out reviews and analysis of core Department services, processes and identifies changes that lead to business improvements. The role contributes technical and thought leadership to the development, implementation, integration and ongoing support of systems and tools to meet end user requirements. The role contributes to a high-performance team environment, provides excellent customer service and enables continual service improvement practices.





Key Responsibilities: 

Develop requirements and scope process/systems change proposals and statements to support the Department’s business technologies, systems and tools; ensure compliance with the Department’s approved project management standards, methodologies, tools and/or systems

Create and provide relevant artefacts to manage process in a controlled and governed manner

Carry out data analysis, mappings and transformations considering accepted best business practice



Selection Criteria:


Strong technical BA experience

Hands-on write/run SQL queries
Proven experience in System Integration projects

Bonus if you have migration from legacy system, Oracle, data mapping and data analysis experience




On offer is a contract unitl 30/06/2026 at a highly sought after NSW Government Organisation, with a highly competitive daily rate.


To send your CV for review, please use the APPLY button below.

Salary: Great salary, bonus, and endless chocolate!
Ad Text:
Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?
Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

Mondelēz International is a global leader within the snacking area with the purpose to empower people to snack right. Our mission is to lead the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack for the right moment made the right way.  We are a company full of the world’s favorite brands including Cadbury Dairy Milk, Oreo, Ritz, Philadelphia, and The Natural Confectionery Company to name a few. 

Do you possess a naturally curious and analytical mind with a passion for understanding consumer and shopper behaviour? Are you driven to translate data into actionable insights that fuel business growth? If so, Mondelēz ANZ invites you to join our team as a Consumer Insights Manager.

About the Role:
As a key strategic partner to our Marketing and Commercial teams across Australia and New Zealand, you will play a critical role in putting the consumer and shopper at the heart of our decision-making. You will be part of a high-performing team responsible for driving top-tier financial results for our high-growth ANZ Snacking portfolio. 

Please note this is a part-time 4 days role.

Key Responsibilities

Proactively participate in key decision-making forums, championing consumer and shopper centricity.

Develop and execute best-in-class insight plans for ANZ Snacking, aligned with business priorities and within budget.

Lead consumer/shopper qualitative and quantitative research to generate actionable insights that shape brand positioning, creative campaigns, product innovation, and design excellence.

Partner with marketing, sales and R&D teams to drive the effectiveness of category & brand strategies and execution of plans.

Transform data into compelling narratives, going beyond the numbers to articulate key implications and strategic recommendations.

 

About You

Naturally curious, proactive, and always seeking better problem-solving approaches.

Tertiary qualified with 5+ years of experience in market research (agency or client-side).

Exposure to a broad range of research projects ideally including shopper, innovation and creative development.

Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights.

Strong communication skills, with the ability to confidently present and discuss insights with stakeholders.

A collaborative team player.

 

Why Mondelēz?

We are a global snacking leader with iconic brands like Cadbury, Oreo, and Ritz.

We offer an inclusive, diverse culture with a commitment to your career-long learning and development.

Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team on an initial contract / fixed term contract to assist our customer with data profiling, quality assessments and metrics development to quantify benefits and validate assumptions to form part of a business case.
  
Expected Duties

Build and optimize data pipelines using tools like Databricks, Amazon Redshift, and SQL
Configure and Query Redshift DW
Profile and assess large-scale datasets for quality, completeness, and sensitivity
Extract data from large data sets, data processing
Identify errors in Macro enabled reports & dashboards (Excel, Power BI & Tableau)
Use SQL for data extraction, filtering and aggregation
Develop scripts using PySpark and Python libraries for data cleaning
Develop dashboards and metrics to track governance maturity and risk mitigation
Perform scenario modeling and impact analysis using real data
Integrate data from diverse systems using RESTful APIs and cloud-native tools
Validate data lineage and metadata
Perform data masking, classification or compliance automation
  
Key Selection Criteria

Masters or Bachelor in Data Science is highly desirable
Demonstrated hands on experience with Data Analysis, Data Engineering or Data Management
Power BI, Tableau
SQL
Excel
Azure Databricks
Amazon Redshift
Python, PySpark
AWS/Azure cloud platforms
Comfortable working with RESTful APIs, data profiling, and quality frameworks
Comfortable with data governance, metadata management, and risk controls

Company description:



We're leading Western Australians to their intelligent energy future.

And we want you to be part of it.

You might know us as Western Australia's largest electricity generator and energy retailer, supporting 1.2 million customers across the state.

But what you might not know, is that we're investing in renewable energy projects, including wind farms and big batteries, to help build a more sustainable and reliable future.

Our Big Battery is now live in Kwinana, we're expanding the Warradarge Wind Farm, the WA EV Network has launched, and we have many other projects in the works.

We're a purpose-driven organisation, owned by the people of WA. Our commitment is to ensure all Western Australians have access to secure, reliable, and sustainable energy.

We believe that the benefits of renewable energy aren't just for some, they're for everyone.

This is where you come in.



Job description:



The Sales Performance Principal role is an exciting opportunity within our Business Customer and Growth team based at our Perth CBD Office.

Reporting directly to the Head of Business Customer and Growth, you will be responsible for the development and execution of sales strategies for our business customers. The role drives business sales performance by embedding market and customer insights, fostering cross-functional collaboration, and ensuring alignment and continuous improvement of sales initiatives. Job responsibilities:
Develop short- and long-term sales strategies aligned with Synergy's vision to provide clear focus across customer channels.
Prepare and leverage customer, market and competitive insights to inform decision-making.
Analyse sales metrics to identify new opportunities improving overall team effectiveness.
Manage the Sales Incentive Scheme, continuously assessing its efficacy in supporting business objectives.
Act as a connector between teams within and outside Customer to deliver aligned outcomes meeting business objectives and customer needs.


Profile description:


Proven ability to lead strategic initiatives across teams and functions and influencing outcomes without direct authority.
Strong analytical, research, and problem-solving capabilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Demonstrated ability to engage and influence a wide range of stakeholders, both internally and externally.
Extensive experience in corporate environments such as energy, resources, banking, sales, consulting or similar.
Passion for delivering value through innovation, collaboration, and a deep understanding of customer needs.


We offer:



So, what's it like working for Synergy?

As one of Australia's most trusted utility brands, we value our customers, the community we operate in, and our people. When you work with us, you'll be joining an inclusive and proactive organisation, one that enables innovative thinking, accountable leadership, and collaboration. It's how we're creating an exceptional workplace, and we want you to be part of it.

At Synergy we have a wide range of benefits designed to help you balance your work and home life, support your health and wellbeing along with having access to professional development opportunities.

Here's a just a few of the benefits you'll have access to as a Synergy employee:

Flexible work arrangements
Paid parental leave for primary and secondary caregivers
Other leave options including reproductive and purchased annual leave
Volunteer leave so you can give back to your community
Learning and development opportunities.

More details can be found here

At Synergy we believe in creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can thrive and feel a true sense of belonging. We're proud to be recognised as an inclusive employer by the Diversity Council of Australia. We celebrate our diversity and warmly welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, especially those from underrepresented groups.

Have we sparked your interest? We hope so. It's an exciting time for energy in Western Australia - and you're connected to it.

Click 'Apply' below to get started with your application.

Applications close 10 October 2025, however Synergy reserves the right to close applications when a suitable pool of candidates is identified.

Need some help?

Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team at recruitment@synergy.net.au.

Assisting with PMO functions such as compliance, scheduling, risk/issue management, dependencies, and financial tracking.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst with a strong track record in Federal Government projects and expertise in ERP and Finance projects.

This multifaceted role will involve assisting with the department's internal ERP transformation as well as supporting a portfolio of smaller government entities in their own system modernisations. A key strategic driver for this initiative is the move away from traditional systems. As such, this role is explicitly focused on non-SAP platforms, with a particular emphasis on modern solutions like Technology One and Aurion.

Australian citizens with a Baseline clearance are desirable for this role.

Role / Responsibilities:

Lead workshops with business areas to understand diverse business requirements and any potential impacts or challenges to the solutions
Facilitate collaboration with peers across the organisation and in external service groups
Document relevant business requirements including defining business need and success criteria.
Work independently or collaboratively to optimise business and data processes and facilitate process re design changes through improvements in information systems, information management, practices, procedures, and organisation change.
Conduct detailed analyses of business processes, requirements, and objectives, ensuring comprehensive understanding of project needs.
Facilitate effective communication by translating complex business requirements into clear, actionable specifications for project teams.
Deliver insightful data interpretation to support informed decision-making and drive business value.
Proactively identify potential challenges and contribute to a collaborative, results-driven project environment.
Skills / Experience:

Demonstrated experience as a Senior Business Analyst on large-scale business or technology transformation projects, preferably within a government context.
Proven experience in leading the end-to-end business analysis process, from initial design and requirements gathering through to implementation support.
Strong experience in analysing and defining requirements for ERP systems. Direct experience with platforms such as Technology One or Aurion is highly desirable.
Expertise in business process re-design (BPR), including 'as-is' and 'to-be' process mapping and optimisation.
Exceptional stakeholder engagement and workshop facilitation skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a high attention to detail and the ability to manage competing priorities.

Senior Modeller - Credit Risk (6-12 Month Contract)

The Opportunity

Join a Leading Banking Client in Sydney as a Senior Modeller for a high-impact 6-12 month contract. This critical role manages the full lifecycle of credit capital models that underpin strategic risk management and regulatory compliance. Excellent Daily Rate offered.



Contract Details

Duration: 6-12 Months

Hybrid Work arrangement - 2 - 3 days in office

Key Accountabilities

You will be responsible for:

End-to-End Modelling: Develop, refine, and document statistical models for credit decisioning, specifically PD, LGD, and EAD.

Maintenance & Analysis: Perform continuous model maintenance, rigorous performance monitoring, and detailed analysis to ensure accuracy and stability.

Data Quality: Lead the sourcing and rigorous data quality checks essential for robust modelling.

Compliance & Insight: Ensure adherence to regulatory standards and provide actionable portfolio optimisation recommendations.

What You'll Bring
Strong quantitative, actuarial, or statistics background

Proven experience in credit risk modelling within a financial services environment.

Expert knowledge of statistical modelling for PD, LGD, and EAD.

Proficiency in SAS and R/ Python and a strong understanding of regulatory requirements.

Apply Now

If you are a driven modeller looking for a high-impact contract role in Sydney, apply today. You can share your resume to riddhi.moitra@randstaddigital.com.au as well.

Company description:



At ENGIE, every talent has a role to play in accelerating the energy transition. Make a difference and enjoy a fulfilling professional experience. Take on exciting challenges and build a career path that reflects who you are.
Join us and be part of the adventure of the century!



Job description:



At ENGIE, great adventures always start with a simple "hello" and the desire to take action for tomorrow. If, like us, you strongly believe the energy transition holds opportunities for you and for everyone, then look no further, you belong with us!
Our goal is to be the best energy transition utility, and we have an ambition to reach net zero emissions by 2045. In Australia, this includes flexible power generation, energy retail services for homes and businesses, advanced energy management solutions, and a growing portfolio of future-focused projects — from hydrogen and battery storage to wind and solar developments.

The Role
We're looking for a commercially minded and analytically driven Commercial/Pricing Analyst to join our team and help shape pricing strategies in the dynamic and fast-evolving energy market. This role is critical in driving revenue growth, enhancing competitiveness, and supporting strategic decisions through robust financial modelling and market insights.

You'll work closely with senior stakeholders across the business, contributing to the development of pricing frameworks, business cases, and commercial models that support both retail and wholesale energy offerings.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain pricing models that reflect market conditions, cost structures, and regulatory frameworks
Analyse revenue, cost drivers, and margin performance to support commercial decision-making
Use market intelligence and data to inform pricing strategies and product development
Build financial models and business cases for new energy products, services, and customer segments
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Finance, Sales, Product, and Regulatory
Recommend improvements to pricing tools, processes, and governance
Support the adoption of new analytical tools and techniques to improve forecasting and scenario analysis

About You

Qualifications & Education

Undergraduate degree in Finance, Commerce, Accounting, or Business (other quantitative disciplines considered with strong financial modelling experience)

Skills & Attributes

Advanced financial modelling and analysis skills, with strong proficiency in Excel
Experience with Power BI, SQL, or other data tools is desirable
Strong commercial acumen, with the ability to link pricing and financial outcomes to broader market dynamics and energy strategy
Comfortable working with cost stacks, margin drivers, and regulatory pricing frameworks
Detail-oriented and proactive, with a focus on accuracy, continuous improvement, and delivering results under tight deadlines
Clear communicator, able to explain financial outcomes and trade-offs to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

ENGIE is an equal opportunity employer, promoting diversity and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. All applications are screened based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without any regard to origin, age, carer's responsibilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, religion, marital status, health, disability or political opinions. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people of the LGBTIQA+ community are encouraged to apply. Our differences are our strengths.

You will collaborate with the Product Factory, Architects, various stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit and define Ideation and Discovery business requirements, analyse solution viability, and document Project deliverables.

You will also cultivate and drive competency uplift within the Transformation office and chapter. You’ll share knowledge by providing coaching and guidance to the Business Analysis community and representing Suncorp at industry events.

What You’ll Do

Lead analysis across multiple streams, guiding delivery teams and stakeholders to define business needs and solutions
Document current and future state processes, identifying opportunities for improvement and innovation
Create high-quality user stories and business documentation to support delivery outcomes
Coach and mentor Business Analysts, supporting capability uplift across the Chapter
Represent Suncorp in external forums, contributing to industry knowledge and promoting our analysis capability
Collaborate across teams to ensure clear communication, risk management, and alignment with strategic goals

What You’ll Bring

8+ years in delivery-focused roles, ideally within financial services or insurance
Advanced knowledge of Agile, Lean, and waterfall methodologies
Experience with tools like JIRA and Confluence, and frameworks such as BABOK and Lean Six Sigma
Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex concepts

CBAP certification and tertiary qualifications in Business, Technology or related fields

What You’ll Enjoy

Access our award-winning Shine platform – your central hub for exclusive perks, wellbeing support, career development, and recognition. Shine has been recognised for excellence in employee experience, making it easier than ever to access what matters most to you.

Paid study support, career breaks, on-the-job learning, and a $1,000 referral bonus for eligible employees
Free wellbeing coaching, a dedicated Employee Council, and confidential EAP access
Discounts at 400+ retailers, insurance savings, gym memberships, and reduced super fees
Paid volunteer leave, donation matching, and unlimited emergency response leave
Performance-based bonuses and Suncorp shares for eligible employees
Diversity is celebrated through employee resource groups and inclusive policies for all families

Lead the migration of on-premise workflows;
Participate in technical discussions with other areas of the agency to solve data related problems and provision of technical leadership and mentoring to a small team, including active knowledge transfer. 

Skills and Experience Required

Experience working in tight-knit Agile teams, providing data capabilities and services to technical and business stakeholders. Communicate well (both verbally and in writing), share knowledge and experiences and document requirements.

We Value Diversity

The role

The Commercial Analyst is responsible for collating and interpreting commercial, sales and financial data to assist in driving the performance of the business. This position plays a key role affecting positive business outcomes through their ability to turn data into actionable information. This is an excellent opportunity to make an impact in the commercial team, work in a large multinational organisation with career development and growth, and hybrid working arrangements available.

Responsibilities:

Review and improve pricing strategies to support business growth.
Gather and report commercial data to help stakeholders make informed decisions.
Boost revenue performance through analysis and strategic recommendations.
Create and improve reporting tools to support product and sales teams.
Support planning activities including budgets, long-term strategies, and capital proposals.

What You Will Need to Succeed:

Over 5 years’ experience in finance or commercial roles, with expertise in pricing and contracts.
Skilled in Power BI, SAP, Salesforce, and Microsoft Office for data analysis and reporting.
Qualified in finance or commercial disciplines, with CA certification and strategic analysis experience.
Strong commercial insight, with a focus on optimising price and margin.
Experienced in using data to drive change and build strategic business relationships.

Our business

Adbri Limited is a constructions materials and industrial minerals manufacturing company that has been building a better Australia since 1882. Adbri's respected brands employ over 1500 people and together provide cement, lime, concrete, aggregates, concrete products, and industrial minerals nationally.

About CRH

CRH (NYSE: CRH) is the leading global provider of building materials solutions that build, connect and improve our world. Employing 80,000 people at 4,000 operating locations in 28 countries, CRH has market leadership positions in North America, Europe and Australia. As the essential partner for transportation and critical infrastructure projects, complex non-residential construction and outdoor living solutions, CRH’s unique offering of materials, products and value-added services helps to deliver a more resilient and sustainable built environment. The company is ranked among sector leaders by Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) rating agencies. A Fortune Global 500 company, CRH’s shares are listed on the NYSE and LSE.

For more information visit: www.crh.com

Creating a safe and supportive diverse workforce

Adbri recognises that diversity in our workforce drives innovation, encourages creativity, and better equips us to be Always Ready. We are committed to increasing diversity within our workforce and our industry and we support flexible work arrangements.

#LI-POST

Lead Performance Reports 


Where you'll be working 

 The Bureau of Health Information (BHI) is a board-governed organisation that provides independent reports on the performance of the NSW public healthcare system. BHI’s primary purpose is to provide timely, accurate and comparable information on the performance of the NSW public healthcare system in ways that enhance the system’s accountability and informs efforts to improve healthcare. Our vision is that BHI is the trusted provider of healthcare performance information, that our information is used to inform decisions, and that this information supports continued improvement to patients’ experiences and outcomes of care in NSW.

BHI shares the CORE values of NSW Health - Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment, and nurtures a culture of teamwork, innovation and excellence. As such we value diversity and inclusion and encourage people from different backgrounds to apply including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from different cultural backgrounds and people with disabilities. Our current team comprises people of diverse career and education backgrounds such as researchers, biostatisticians and data analysts, graphic designers, communication and data visualisation, as well as corporate governance specialists. Our people come from the NSW public and private sectors and other Australian and international organisations and systems. We value transferable experience and initiative as we grow and develop as an inclusive organisation.

BHI is located at 1 Reserve Road in St Leonard’s with great transport links, and local cafes and restaurants. We offer flexible working and accrued days off, as well as encouraging professional development in areas of interest and skills development. We are a vibrant team of people invested in intelligent reporting and best practice leading to real impact for the health sector and promote supportive collegiate relationships. 


What you'll be doing – Lead Performance Reporting 

The Lead Performance Reporting plays a key role in planning, developing and directing analysis and reporting for BHI's health system performance reports. In collaboration with other staff and with advice from stakeholders the Lead manages and contributes to all phases of the report production lifecycle, for a specific topic area. While doing so, the Lead contributes to appropriate positioning of the Bureau as a respected and trusted provider of timely, accurate and comparable information on the performance of the NSW public health system. 

 
Employment Details 

Employment Type: Full Time, Permanent 
Position Classification: Health Manager Level 4
Remuneration: $141,974.00 - $ 169,151.00 per annum, plus superannuation 
Location: St Leonards 
Hours Per Week: 38 
Requisition ID: REQ608950 
 

How to apply  

For your application to be considered please include: 

Responses by addressing the selection criteria below 
A cover letter of no more than two (2) pages highlighting your skills and experience as relevant to this role in relation to the selection criteria 
An up-to-date resume of no more than five (5) pages which clearly details your current and past roles, your responsibilities, and key contributions to projects as well as achievements 

Application must be lodged electronically. Please go to https://jobs.health.nsw.gov.au/ and search Job Reference Number REQ608950 to submit your application. 

Selection Criteria 

Demonstrated knowledge of state, national and international trends in health system performance measurement and reporting.

Demonstrated significant experience in leading planning, development (research and analysis), writing and publication of health system reports.

Experience managing complex projects with competing priorities and deadlines, and ability to motivate staff collaborating on projects including those who may not have direct reporting relationship.

Able to interpret complex statistical information for a range of audiences.

Familiarity with the challenges of working with large, population based administrative and survey data.

Demonstrated expertise in areas such as measuring and reporting on access, quality, experiences, outcomes and efficiency of health services and systems.

Advanced oral and written communication, interpersonal, negotiation, consultation and presentation skills.

Proven strengths in all aspects of staff management.

  2) Find out more about applying for this position 

 For role related queries or questions contact Lilian Daly on lilian.daly@health.nsw.gov.au

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - Business Services & Operating Model
Ad Text:
Employment Type: Full-time (35 hours p/week)
Duration: 12-Month Fixed-Term Contract
Salary: Level 9 $148,012 - $157,055 + 17% Super + Leave Loading
Location: UNSW Kensington Campus (Hybrid Working)

About UNSW:
UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community, a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you’re in the right place.

Why Your Role Matters:
This Senior Business Analyst will play a key role in the Operating Model stream of a major transformation program. You’ll work with multiple stakeholders to document end-to-end processes, support the set-up of governance structures, and embed effective ways of working.

In this role, you’ll contribute to process standardisation, operational manuals, and SOPs, and create clear RACI models and governance documentation. You’ll also support senior stakeholders with the development of program materials and packs, ensuring clarity and alignment across the program.

Responsibilities include:

Lead the investigation, analysis, and documentation of end-to-end business processes.
Support the design and implementation of governance structures, cadence, and frameworks.
Develop RACI models, SOPs, operational manuals, and other governance documentation.
Create high-quality materials and packs to support program governance and decision-making.
Facilitate workshops to map current (‘as is’) and future (‘to be’) processes.
Identify business process issues and opportunities for improvement.
Build and maintain effective stakeholder relationships across the program.
Provide mentoring, advice, and knowledge-sharing within the BA team.

For more information regarding the responsibilities for this role, please refer to the Position Description at JOBS@UNSW.

Skills and Experience Summary:

Relevant tertiary qualification and demonstrated experience with business requirements analysis and business process analysis using appropriate frameworks.
Certified Practitioner in Business Analysis (IIBA or PMP).
Demonstrated experience in applying Lean Six Sigma skills (certification desirable).
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a track record as a lateral thinker.
Proven facilitation skills, including workshops with diverse groups (vendors, technical staff, end users).
Strong time management and organisational skills with the ability to deliver to project timeframes.
Understanding of business processes within a tertiary education environment.
Understanding of change management principles.
Extensive experience documenting end-to-end processes, standard operating procedures, RACIs, and operational manuals.
Demonstrated experience supporting governance structures, cadence, and frameworks.
Proven ability to prepare high-quality governance and executive packs (e.g., PowerPoint) for senior stakeholders.
Experience working on large, complex transformation programs in a consulting capacity.

Benefits and Culture: People are at the core of everything we do. We recognise it is the contributions of our staff who make UNSW one of the best universities in Australia and the world.  Our benefits include: 

Career development opportunities 
17% Superannuation contributions and additional leave loading payments 
Additional 3 days of leave over Christmas period 
Discounts and entitlements (retail, education, fitness)

How to Apply: Make each day matter with a meaningful career at UNSW. Submit your CV along with a cover letter that addresses your suitability for the position in relation to the selection criteria (listed under the ‘Skills & Experience’ section of the PD) via the application portal before 14 October at 11:30pm.

Please note: Applications may be reviewed and progressed as they are received. The advertisement may close early if we receive a high volume of applications, so we encourage you to apply without delay.

A copy of the Position Description can be found on JOBS@UNSW.

Get in Touch: For queries regarding the recruitment process, contact Lucy Gerondis, Talent Acquisition Consultant, UNSW: l.gerondis@unsw.edu.au

Applications sent via email will not be accepted, please apply via the application portal.

UNSW is committed to evolving a culture that embraces equity and supports a diverse and inclusive community where everyone can participate fairly, in a safe and respectful environment. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and encourage applications from people of diverse gender, sexual orientation, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people with disability and those with caring and family responsibilities. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.

The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

Initial 6 Month contract 
Hybrid working arrangments
Cyber security program

We are seeking a highly skilled and analytical Business Intelligence & Cybersecurity Reporting Specialist with deep expertise in Power BI and SQL, a strong understanding of cybersecurity compliance frameworks, and proven experience in the higher education sector. This role is pivotal in transforming complex data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across IT, security, and governance functions.
Key Responsibilities:

Power BI & SQL Development: Design, develop, and maintain advanced Power BI dashboards and reports. Leverage strong SQL skills for efficient data extraction, transformation, and optimization across diverse data sources.
Cybersecurity Compliance Reporting: Build and manage dashboards aligned with cybersecurity frameworks such as the ACSC Essential Eight. Provide clear visibility into compliance maturity, audit readiness, and control effectiveness.
Higher Education Analytics:
Deliver insights across the student lifecycle, teaching and learning, and IT/cybersecurity operations. Apply sector-specific knowledge to support university-wide strategic initiatives.
Data Modelling & Governance:
Apply expertise in DAX and data modelling to ensure secure, accurate, and scalable reporting. Uphold BI governance standards to maintain data integrity and stakeholder trust.
Stakeholder Engagement:
Collaborate with IT Operations, Security, and Governance teams to deliver actionable insights. Support executive decision-making through clear communication and data-driven recommendations.
Qualifications & Skills:

Advanced proficiency in Power BI, DAX, and SQL
Experience with cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., ACSC Essential Eight)
Strong understanding of university operations and data ecosystems
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Knowledge of BI governance and data security best practices

About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Find out more about us at www.accenture.com.

What you’ll do 

As a Pega Lead Decisioning Architect, your day to day activities include working closely with client’s senior architect designing Pega Customer Decision Hub (CDH). Your good understanding of transactional/relational/open database and integration systems (REST, SOAP and Kafka) will help you become successful in this role.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the development, documentation, and embedment of best practice PEGA utilisation guidelines and framework across Customer Engagement that contribute to the increasing standardisation and quality in the utilisation of the PEGA capability as it aligns to the Customer Engagement strategic (Customer Engagement and Contact strategy), operational (PEGA platform maintenance), and delivery (communications automation)
Drive the maintenance, continuous refinement, and uplift of the PEGA platform, which includes the definition, execution, and management of a platform strategy and the accompanying roadmap of initiatives, ensuring alignment to Client’s enterprise technology and Martech strategy and the Customer Engagement and contact strategy
Establish and cultivate strong relationships with key internal stakeholders across Client, providing SME to develop and ideate on valuable and effective customer decisioning solutions (Next Best Action) through the simple, practical, and accessible articulation of PEGA, to the end of assisting them in achieving their Customer Engagement ambitions and targets through advocacy of the PEGA platform and capability
Lead the PEGA Decisioning Architects in their activities with the Content management team, Campaign Leads, and Campaign Squads to ensure the delivery of communications that are timely, relevant, and personalised within the scope of their Customer Engagement initiative and respective value stream. This includes continuously identifying and implementing opportunities that improve the decisioning solution to the end of greater customer engagement and outcomes
Accountable for the troubleshooting and remediation of decisioning related issues that may arise, which includes eliciting learnings to inform and prevent the future recurrence of the same error
Responsible for the development and communication of reporting to key internal stakeholders that provides insights and analysis on the success of decisioning solutions across the end-to-end value streams, on top of eliciting learnings and recommendations that help optimise and uplift the decisioning framework and solutions (with support from the PEGA Decisioning Architects within their respective Customer Engagement Value Streams, and in collaboration with the Analytics & Optimisation team)
Leading and maturing a high-performance team of PEGA Decisioning Architects, uplifting skills and capabilities and innovating with methodologies and practices to improve quality and velocity
Solid understanding and hands on knowledge of NBAD framework, Prediction Studio, Simulation Testing

Job Title: Director, Workforce Planning, Insights and Reporting
Category:
General/Business Unit Manager (CEO & General Management)
Other (Education & Training)
Ad Text:
Position Number: JR-005193
Location: Parkville
Role Type: Full-time, Continuing
Department: Employment Compliance Directorate, CPO
Salary: An attractive remuneration package to be offered, including 17% superannuation


Lead high-impact workforce analytics function / Influence senior leadership decisions

Apply now to lead transformative workforce planning and drive strategic decision-making across the University

The University of Melbourne
We take pride in our people, who contribute to our mission of benefiting society through the transformative impact of education and research. Discover more via our website and stay connected with our stories and people on LinkedIn.

Your next career opportunity:
As the Director of Workforce Planning, Insights & Reporting, you'll bring together enterprise-wide workforce planning and workforce data analytics functions into one team. You'll have the opportunity to influence high-impact decisions, collaborating with senior leaders to align workforce strategy with the University's broader objectives. Your expertise in advanced analytics and workforce strategy will be crucial in shaping the institution's future.

Your responsibilities will include:

Leading Strategic Workforce Planning: Develop and implement a University-wide workforce planning framework, aligning with financial and strategic priorities. Conduct scenario modelling and forecasting based on key factors.

Driving Data-Driven Insights: Provide senior leadership with actionable workforce insights, performance metrics, and trends analysis to support strategic decision-making.

Fostering Key Partnerships: Build strong collaborations across the university and empower areas to facilitate workforce planning strategies in alignment with University workforce strategies.

Advocating for an Evidence-Based Culture: Lead a high-performing team and promote a culture of innovation, learning, and data-driven decision-making across the University.

You may be a great fit if:
You are an experienced leader in workforce planning and analytics, with a passion for data and proven track record of delivering strategic insights and driving organisational success in complex environments.

You will also:

Possess a postgraduate qualification in a relevant field or equivalent experience.

Have extensive senior leadership experience in workforce planning or strategic HR within large organisations.

Demonstrate advanced knowledge of workforce analytics, modelling, and business intelligence tools.

Excel in stakeholder engagement and collaboration across diverse organisational functions with experience with change management desirable.

Show strong strategic thinking capabilities, including scenario planning and forecasting.

Be an excellent listener and communicator, able to give voice to others while clearly conveying complex information to diverse audiences.

Possess the ability to lead high-performing teams and manage cross-functional initiatives with measurable impact.

Your new team - Employment Compliance Directorate
The Employment Compliance Directorate (ECD) is a key Centre of Excellence within the Chief People Officer portfolio. We champion workplace compliance and data-driven decision-making across the University. ECD partners with the University community to ensure adherence to workplace laws and regulations. Through its focus on fair remuneration, workforce insights, and policy guidance, ECD fosters a culture of compliance and continuous improvement, enabling the University to meet its obligations while attracting and retaining top talent.


What we offer you!
In addition to being part of a vibrant and purpose-driven community, you will enjoy a range of benefits, including:

Generous leave provisions

Salary packaging

Health and well-being services

Discounts on graduate courses

Flexible and hybrid working options

Be yourself
The University of Melbourne values the unique backgrounds and experiences of each individual. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people of all ages, abilities, ethnicities, genders, sexualities and faiths. Learn more about our Diversity and Inclusion efforts.

We are committed to inclusive recruitment practices. If you require any reasonable adjustments, please reach out to the contact listed below.

Join Us!
If this role sounds like the right fit for you, please apply with the following documents:


Resume

Cover Letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

You are not required to respond to the selection criteria in the Position Description.

Apply via the Apply Now button below. For enquiries about the recruitment process, contact Lachlan Bryce at hr-careers@unimelb.edu.au, referencing the Position Number and Job Title.

Position Description: JR 005193 - Director Workforce Planning Insights Reporting_PD.pdf

Applications close: 20th October 2025 at 12:01 AM AEDT (Melbourne time)

To apply, you must submit the following:

Your current résumé; and
A 2-page statement outlining your suitability for this position. Your statement is to include examples and outcomes achieved in previous roles to demonstrate that you possess the key attributes to perform successfully in this specific role. Your statement should address the requirements set out in the basis of selection as listed in the role description.

Before applying, please ensure you read the full Role Description attached. Further information on preparing your application is contained in the Applicant Information Kit. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact the person listed in the Job Details.

We are seeking applicants who, within the context of the role responsibilities, possess the following key attributes:

Expert leadership skills with demonstrated capabilities and experience in managing the complex and diverse coordination of mission-critical environments.
High level skills in communication, negotiation, consultation, and collaboration with the proven ability to build and maintain productive relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to drive and influence organisational change and reforms to make service delivery systems increasingly responsive and proactive, including ability to lead and inspire diverse, professional teams, in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Providing superior intelligence and analysis in a mission-critical environment that operates within an Incident Management System (IMS), and to implement governance and integrity in this process.
Detailed knowledge and ability to rapidly analyse intelligence and data to identify issues affecting service delivery with a proven ability to apply relevant resource management principles to support the provision of high-quality pre-hospital patient care to the Queensland community.
Demonstrated expert analytical and critical thinking skills to contribute to the development, implementation, and review of operational plans, policies, standards, local work practices and service improvement initiatives.
Experience in data analysis and business intelligence including the ability to convey technical information with non-technical audiences.

The following mandatory requirements, special conditions and/or other requirements apply to this role:

Whilst not mandatory, a tertiary qualification in Business Intelligence, Health Services Administration, or a related field will be highly desirable.
This position may require participation in additional hours or overtime during critical incident periods.

Applications to remain current for 12 months.
